content: शिव {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [श्यति पापं शो-वन् पृषो°] {@--1@} Auspicious, propitious, lucky; इयं शिवाया नियतेरिवायतिः <ls>Ki. 4. 21</ls>; <ls n="Ki.">1. 38</ls>; <ls>R. 11. 33.</ls> {@--2@} In good health or condition, happy, prosperous, fortunate; शिवाति वस्तीर्थज लानि कच्चित् <ls>R. 5. 8</ls> (= अतुपप्लवानि ‘undisturbed’); शिवास्त पंथानः संतु ‘a happy journey to you’, ‘God bless (or speed) you on your journey’. --वः {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of the third god of the sacred Hindu Trinity, who is entrusted with the work of destruction, as Brahman and Viṣṇu are with the creation and preservation, of the world; एको दवः केशवो वा शिवो वा <ls>Bh. 2. 115.</ls> {@--2@} The male organ of generation, penis. {@--3@} An auspicious planetary conjunction. {@--4@} The Veda. {@--5@} Final beatitude. {@--6@} A post to which cattle are tied {@--7@} A god, deity, {@--8@} Quick-silver. {@--9@} Bdellium. {@--10@} The black variety of thorn-apple. --वौ ({%<ab>m.</ab>%} dual) Śiva and Pārvatī कथयति शिवयोः शरीरयोगं विषमपदा पदवी विवर्तनेषु <ls>Ki. 5. 40.</ls> --वं {@--1@} Prosperity, welfare, wellbeing, happiness; तव वर्त्मान वर्ततां शिवं <ls>N. 2. 62</ls>; <ls>Ratn. 1. 2</ls>; <ls>R. 1. 60.</ls> {@--2@} Bliss, auspiciousness. {@--3@} Final beatitude. {@--4@} Water. {@--5@} Sea-salt. {@--6@} Rock-salt {@--7@} Refined borax.
